meanings.definition: The quality or state of being controllable.
meanings.sent1: The controllability of the toy car made it easy for the child to steer.
meanings.sent2: The controllability of the volume on the TV allowed the family to adjust it to their liking.
meanings.sent3: The controllability of the remote control car led to a fun race around the living room.
meanings.sent4: Her controllability in managing the project was like a skilled conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The controllability of the robot vacuum made cleaning the house a breeze.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something can be controlled.
meanings.sent1: The controllability of the situation was evident as the teacher calmly handled the disruptive student.
meanings.sent2: The controllability of the speed of the treadmill allowed the runner to adjust their pace easily.
meanings.sent3: The controllability of the weather during the picnic made everyone laugh as they scrambled to pack up before the rain.
meanings.sent4: His controllability over his emotions was like a skilled surfer riding the waves of anger.
meanings.sent5: The controllability of the traffic lights kept the flow of cars moving smoothly through the intersection.
